data.enText: the practice of treating sb or a particular group in society less fairly than others

data.chText: 年龄 / 种族 / 性别歧视
data.enText: age/racial/sex/sexual discrimination (= because of sb's age, race or sex)
discrimination in favour of the young

data.chText: 按照种族、性别或性取向给予区别对待
data.enText: discrimination on the grounds of race, gender, or sexual orientation
the ability to judge what is good, true, etc.

data.chText: 他在择友方面颇具慧眼。
data.enText: He showed great discrimination in his choice of friends.
the ability to recognize a difference between one thing and another; a difference that is recognized
to learn discrimination between right and wrong

tr: unfair treatment of a person or group on the basis of prejudice
the cognitive process whereby two or more stimuli are distinguished

value.def: Discrimination is the practice of treating one person or group of people less fairly or less well than other people or groups.

example.ex: She is exempt from sex discrimination laws.
example.tran: 她免受性别歧视法的追究。

value.def: Discrimination is knowing what is good or of high quality.

example.ex: They cooked without skill and ate without discrimination.
example.tran: 他们烹调手艺不高，也不挑食。

value.def: Discrimination is the ability to recognize and understand the differences between two things.

example.ex: ...the system that allows a mother to make the discrimination between her own and alien lambs.
example.tran: 可以让母羊辨别她自己的小羊和外来羊羔的系统

trans: 积极区别对待政策(对因种族、性别等原因遭歧视的群体在就业等方面给予特别照顾)
